title: Quiz 4: Coaching for Performance
description: Evaluate your knowledge of coaching as a leadership tool, its characteristics, types, and the steps for effective coaching.

questions.question: How is 'Coaching' primarily defined in the context of facilitative supervision?

options.text: A method to punish underperforming staff.
A training approach to achieve continuous improvement through motivation and modeling.
A therapy session for personal problems.
A rigid instruction manual reading session.

questions.explanation: Coaching is a training approach that seeks continuous improvement through motivation, modeling, practice, and feedback.
questions.hint: Think about sports coaches: they motivate and model.

questions.question: Order the steps of effective coaching:
questions.explanation: The correct sequence is Motivate -> Demonstrate -> Practice -> Feedback -> Transfer skills.
questions.hint: You can't practice before you see it demonstrated.

questions.question: Which of the following should a supervisor AVOID when coaching? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Effective coaches should avoid giving solutions (let the coachee solve it), judging, and blaming/criticizing. They SHOULD listen more than talk.

questions.question: Match the type of coaching to its description:

pairs.right: Facilitates life experience and personal growth
Expert in one aspect e.g., stress or career

questions.explanation: Life coaching is personal; Executive is business-focused; Niche is specialized.

questions.question: Coaching typically focuses on developing individuals within their current jobs.
questions.explanation: True. One characteristic of coaching is that it focuses on developing individuals within their current jobs.
questions.hint: Is coaching about the current role or a future unrelated role?

questions.question: In the ___BLANK___ stage of coaching, the coach and coachee clarify and refine what the relationship should achieve.
questions.explanation: Stage Two is the 'Setting Direction Stage' where goals are clarified.
questions.hint: It involves choosing a path or goal.

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of coaching?

options.text: It allows staff to learn on the job.
It removes the need for the employee to think.
It is an indefinite relationship that never ends.
It isolates the employee from the team.

questions.explanation: Coaching allows staff to learn on the job and apply learning immediately.

questions.question: According to Whitmore (2003), coaching is unlocking a person's potential to:
questions.explanation: Whitmore defines coaching as unlocking potential to maximize one's own performance.
questions.hint: It's about the individual's best performance.

questions.question: Coaching relationships are usually infinite and last forever.
questions.explanation: False. The coaching relationship is finite and often ends when an individual transfers or goals are met.
questions.hint: Does any business relationship last forever?

questions.question: Which of the following are characteristics of an effective supervisor coach? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Effective coaches listen, model accountability, and encourage risk-taking. They remain curious, not defensive.
